line_1: From the wrong'd Iber to the threaten'd Rhine.
From the wrong'd Iber to the threaten'd Rhine.
And Groves of Lances glitter on the Rhine,
line_2: Let Volga's Banks with Iron Squadrons shine,

line_1: Then once more will I trace the Rhine,
line_2: And mark the Rhone's swift billows shine;

line_1: Shall shortly seek for Shelter from the Rhine,
line_2: Thy Troops, that now behind the Danube join,

line_1: And stain with blood the Danube or the Rhine;
line_2: For such in distant lands the Britons shine,

line_1: And swell the imperial Danube or the Rhine. —
line_2: Rush into day, in foamy torrents shine,
She bade her harness'd warriors shine,

line_1: Or on the Rubicon, or on the Rhine.
line_2: Alike or when or where, they shone or shine,

line_1: From Rhone's fair Banks transplanted to the Rhine.
line_2: Thro' Chalon next; and there with Nassaw join,
But fill your glass, and drink your wine;

line_1: To say how Louis did not pass the Rhine,
line_2: When thy young Muse invok'd the tuneful Nine,
